summary: This document is an email chain from June-July 2019 among FBI and DOJ personnel coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It shows internal planning for investigative coordination between the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and FBI units.

persons.name: Connell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who supervises forensic interviewers and would participate in the planned conference call about Epstein victim interviews.

connections.description: Both are involved in victim services and forensic interviewing for the FBI, with Connell supervising CAFIs.

events.title: Planned conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: A conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case among FBI and DOJ personnel.

events.title: SDNY meeting and ADIC case brief
events.description: Reference to a 2:00 meeting at SDNY and an ADIC-requested case brief scheduled for 3:30 PM, indicating coordination between SDNY and FBI on the Epstein investigation.

locations: Seattle (mentioned as travel location for an email participant)
keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively coordinating victim interview strategies for the Epstein case in June-July 2019.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was involved in meetings related to the Epstein investigation during this period.
The FBI's Victim Services Division, specifically the Child Victim Services Unit, was engaged in planning forensic interviews of victims.
An Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case brief on the Epstein investigation for July 1, 2019, indicating high-level oversight.
Multiple redacted email addresses and names appear throughout the chain, suggesting coordination among several law enforcement officials whose identities are not fully disclosed.
